name: react-native
description:
React Native brings React's declarative UI framework to iOS and Android. With React Native, you use native UI controls and have full access to the native platform.

The Nx Plugin for React Native contains generators for managing React Native applications and libraries within an Nx workspace. It provides:


- Integration with libraries such as Jest, Detox, and Storybook.

- Scaffolding for creating buildable libraries that can be published to npm.

- Utilities for automatic workspace refactoring.

documentation.name: Overview
documentation.content:
![React Logo](/shared/react-logo.png)

React Native brings React's declarative UI framework to iOS and Android. With React Native, you use native UI controls and have full access to the native platform.

The Nx Plugin for React Native contains generators for managing React Native applications and libraries within an Nx workspace. It provides:

- Integration with libraries such as Jest, Detox, and Storybook.
- Scaffolding for creating buildable libraries that can be published to npm.
- Utilities for automatic workspace refactoring.

## Setting Up React Native

### Create a New Workspace

The easiest way to create your workspace is via `npx`.

```bash
npx create-nx-workspace your-workspace-name \
--preset=react-native \
--appName=your-app-name
```

**Note:** You can also run the command without arguments to go through the interactive prompts.

```bash
npx create-nx-workspace your-workspace-name
```

### Adding React Native to an Existing Workspace

For existing Nx workspaces, install the `@nrwl/react-native` package to add React Native capabilities to it.

```bash
npm install @nrwl/react-native --save-dev

# Or with yarn
yarn add @nrwl/react-native --dev
```

### Generating Applications

To create additional React Native apps run:

```bash
nx g @nrwl/react-native:app your-app-name
```

### Generating Libraries

To generate a new library run:

```bash
npx nx g @nrwl/react-native:lib your-lib-name
```

### Generating Components

To generate a new component inside library run:

```bash
npx nx g @nrwl/react-native:component your-component-name --project=your-lib-name --export
```

Replace `your-lib-name` with the app's name as defined in your workspace.json file.

## Using React Native

- [run-ios](/react-native/run-ios) - Builds your app and starts it on iOS simulator or device
- [run-android](/react-native/run-android) - Builds your app and starts it on a connected Android emulator or device
- [build-android](/react-native/build-android) - Release Build for Android
- [start](/react-native/package) - Starts the server that communicates with connected devices
- [bundle](/web/package) - Builds the JavaScript bundle for offline use
- [sync-deps](/react-native/sync-deps) - Syncs dependencies to package.json (required for autolinking)
- [ensure-symlink](/react-native/ensure-symlink) - Ensure workspace node_modules is symlink under app's node_modules folder

## More Documentation

- [Using Detox](/detox/overview)
- [Using Jest](/jest/overview)

unitTestRunner.description: Adds the specified unit test runner.

e2eTestRunner.description: Adds the specified E2E test runner.

schema.title: Create a React Application for Nx
schema.description: Create a React Application for Nx.

examples.description: Use class components instead of functional components

name.x-prompt: What name would you like to use for the application?

displayName.description: The display name to show in the application. Defaults to name.

directory.description: The directory of the new application.

linter.description: The tool to use for running lint checks.

unitTestRunner.description: Test runner to use for unit tests

tags.description: Add tags to the application (used for linting).

js.description: Generate JavaScript files rather than TypeScript files

setParserOptionsProject.description: Whether or not to configure the ESLint `parserOptions.project` option. We do not do this by default for lint performance reasons.

e2eTestRunner.description: Adds the specified e2e test runner.

schema.title: Create a React Native Library for Nx
schema.description: Create a React Native Library for Nx.

name.x-prompt: What name would you like to use for the library?

directory.description: A directory where the lib is placed.

linter.description: The tool to use for running lint checks.

unitTestRunner.description: Test runner to use for unit tests.

tags.description: Add tags to the library (used for linting).

skipTsConfig.description: Do not update `tsconfig.json` for development experience.

pascalCaseFiles.description: Use pascal case component file name (e.g. `App.tsx`).

importPath.description: The library name used to import it, like `@myorg/my-awesome-lib`.

js.description: Generate JavaScript files rather than TypeScript files.

globalCss.description: When `true`, the stylesheet is generated using global CSS instead of CSS modules (e.g. file is `*.css` rather than `*.module.css`).

strict.description: Whether to enable tsconfig strict mode or not.

setParserOptionsProject.description: Whether or not to configure the ESLint `parserOptions.project` option. We do not do this by default for lint performance reasons.

schema.title: Create a React Native Component for Nx
schema.description: Create a React native Component for Nx.

examples.description: Generate a component in the `mylib` library
Generate a class component in the `mylib` library

project.x-prompt: What is the name of the project for this component?

name.x-prompt: What name would you like to use for the component?

js.description: Generate JavaScript files rather than TypeScript files.

skipTests.description: When true, does not create `spec.ts` test files for the new component.

directory.description: Create the component under this directory (can be nested).

flat.description: Create component at the source root rather than its own directory.

export.description: When true, the component is exported from the project `index.ts` (if it exists).
export.x-prompt: Should this component be exported in the project?

pascalCaseFiles.description: Use pascal case component file name (e.g. `App.tsx`).

classComponent.description: Use class components instead of functional component.

generateStories.description: Automatically generate *.stories.ts files for components declared in this project?

js.description: Generate JavaScript files rather than TypeScript files.

linter.description: The tool to use for running lint checks.

standaloneConfig.description: Split the project configuration into `<projectRoot>/project.json` rather than including it inside `workspace.json`.

generators.description: Set up Storybook for a React-native application or library.

generators.name: component-story

project.description: The project name where to add the components.

componentPath.x-prompt: What's path of the component relative to the project's lib root?

generators.description: Generate Storybook story for a React-native component.

generators.name: upgrade-native

schema.title: React native upgrade native configuration
schema.description: Upgrade native iOS and Android code to latest.

displayName.description: The display name to show in the application. Defaults to name.

js.description: Generate JavaScript files rather than TypeScript files

e2eTestRunner.description: Adds the specified e2e test runner.

generators.description: Destructive command to upgrade native iOS and Android code to latest.

appId.description: Specify an `applicationId` to launch after build. If not specified, `package` from `AndroidManifest.xml` will be used.

appIdSuffix.description: Specify an `applicationIdSuffix` to launch after build.

mainActivity.description: Name of the activity to start.

deviceId.description: Builds your app and starts it on a specific device/simulator with the given device id (listed by running `adb devices` on the command line).

tasks.description: Run custom Gradle tasks. If this argument is provided, then `--variant` option is ignored. Example: `yarn react-native run-android --tasks clean,installDebug`.

jetifier.description: Run Jetifier â€“ the AndroidX transition tool. By default it runs before Gradle to ease working with libraries that don't support AndroidX yet.

sync.description: Syncs npm dependencies to `package.json` (for React Native autolink).

port.description: The port where the packager server is listening on.

terminal.description: Launches the Metro Bundler in a new window using the specified terminal path.

interactive.description: Run packager server in interactive mode.

xcodeConfiguration.description: Explicitly set the Xcode configuration to use.

scheme.description: Explicitly set the Xcode scheme to use.

simulator.description: Explicitly set simulator to use. Optionally include iOS version between parenthesis at the end to match an exact version: `iPhone X (12.1)`.

device.description: Explicitly set device to use by name. The value is not required if you have a single device connected.

install.description: Runs `pod install` for native modules before building iOS app.

sync.description: Syncs npm dependencies to `package.json` (for React Native autolink). Always true when `--install` is used.

port.description: The port where the packager server is listening on.

terminal.description: Launches the Metro Bundler in a new window using the specified terminal path.

interactive.description: Run packager server in interactive mode.

executors.name: bundle

schema.title: Offline JS Bundle for React Native

entryFile.description: The entry file relative to project root.

bundleOutput.description: The output path of the generated files.

maxWorkers.description: The number of workers we should parallelize the transformer on.

sourceMap.description: Whether source maps should be generated or not.

executors.description: Builds the JavaScript bundle for offline use.

apk.description: Generate apk file(s) rather than a bundle (`.aab`).

debug.description: Generate a debug build instead of a release build.

gradleTask.description: Override default gradle task incase of multi build variants

executors.name: start

interactive.description: Run packager server in interactive mode.

executors.description: Starts the Javascript server that communicates with connected devices.

include.description: A comma-separated list of additional npm packages to include. e.g. `nx sync-deps --include=react-native-gesture-handler,react-native-safe-area-context`

executors.name: ensure-symlink

schema.title: Ensure Symlink for React Native
schema.description: Ensure workspace node_modules is symlink under app's node_modules folder.

executors.description: Ensure workspace `node_modules` is symlink under app's `node_modules` folder.

searchDir.description: The directory or directories, relative to the project root, to search for files in.

outputFile.description: The output file that will be written. It is relative to the project directory.

pattern.description: The pattern of files to look at. It can be a specific file, or any valid glob. Note: if using the CLI, globs with `**/*...` must be escaped with quotes
